name: Iron Snout
description: Iron Snout is a fast, colorful and brutal fighting game in which you will be helping a piglet fight for its life against hordes of wolves.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Vista, 7 or 8 Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: 128MB Storage: 20 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Developer:  SnoutUp  Publisher:  SnoutUp  Release Date:  27th January 2016  Platform:  Windows, Linux, OSX [Steam], iOS, Android, Windows Mobile  Price:  Free  Disclaimer: The following review was conducted on PC via Steam.   A kung-fu fighting pig, I am not sure where this idea came from, but it seriously gets you in the mood for bacon!   IronSnout is a simple beat‚Äôem up game without horizontal movement where you play as a kung-fu fighting pig. You encounter a continuous stream of enemies which come in the form of wolves. This is referencing the Three Little Pigs and the Big Bad Wolf, one would assume. The game play is simple to learn, but very challenging to become slightly good at. The game is all about leader boards, competing against your friends and other players world wide. The more points you score from carrying out combos of strikes, and the longer you last before your Pig becomes bacon sandwiches all contribute to your final score. You will find it tricky enough to break the one minute barrier most of the time, but when you do you soon come up against an increasingly challenging onslaught of wolves wielding axes, chainsaws, and riding rockets trying to be your end.   It is easy to see why this game has been released on so many platforms, but it is certainly a game more suited for either using a controller on for PC, or the touchscreen of phones. I tried playing using the keyboard controls and it is just a huge fumble-fest to say the least. Once trying to use the Xbox controller, you will see a noticeable difference in the way you are able to play the game.   Iron Snout‚Äôs art style is pleasantly presented in a simplistic cartoon form, nothing too fancy, and this is another element which makes it undoubtedly clear that this is a mobile port that has reached the PC platform. I personally would of liked to have seen a little variety in the background or maybe some different styles of enemies design being thrown at you rather than the same sprites over and over again. That being said, you can‚Äôt ask for much more from a free-to-play game.    If you like the sort of game where you can pick up and play for a few minutes and then put it back down again, then Iron Snout is going to tick that box for you, you‚Äôll find it difficult to play this game for long periods of time, I think I maybe played it at most for 10 minutes at a time, any more than that and you‚Äôll simply grow bored of the repetitive gameplay; but because of how quick it is to get into a game, and how quick games usually are to finish, this is the sort of game that has you keep coming back for more. The large amount of replay ability from this factor is definitely one of the strongest points from this title.   Although Iron Snout is a free to play game, it doesn‚Äôt come with all of the regular free to play baggage we have come to expect such as microtransactions or pay-wall barriers, this is simply put, a game that you can play to it‚Äôs full potential, for free - No hidden catches. It‚Äôs worth a small amount of your time to try it out and experience it for yourself. I for one have also downloaded this game onto my phone for that extra hit of Beat‚Äôem up bacon action on the go too. I urge you too, to try this little game out.      Tom's Score Card   1) Stay away 2) Not Recommended 3) Only recommended when on sale   4) Recommended   5) Highly recommended 6) This is a must play  If you found this review helpful, please give it a thumbs up. If you would also like to follow my reviews more easily, be sure to join my group by clicking  here  and checking out the  TeamTom Review site  [teamtomreviews.co.uk]

This game is what we had before the industry became what it is now. It is fun, multiplatform, free, has no microtransactions, no ads and isn't buggy. Also it's only few MBs. It's like someone actually enjoys making games.  10/10 would expect it to be 15 euro like a lot of very simple couch multiplayer games we have nowadays. Of course I wouldn't buy it for 15 euro, because that'd be ridiculous. Certainly worth more than 0 euro though, good job.
This is how the three little piggies should have ended.
It's a very fun little game. And it makes you feel like a badass!
A fun game with interesting gameplay and that's free? Look no further.  Packed with multitude of content in a small size with   not hard   achievements.   9.5/10
Super addicting and super awesome!

One Finger Death Punch free bacon edition.  I got an achievement for getting humped by a mini wolf. While another wolf blew his red rocket in my face. So I chopped his head off and fed it to grandma. I regret nothing.

My girlfriend loves piglets. And hates violent/bloody games. She has beaten my top score within 2 days of being presented to this game. 11/10 would turn his kawaii peaceful girlfriend into a wolf slaying kung fu snouted machine again.

Iron Snout! A somewhat fun game where the only thing that isn't trying to go against you is the main menu! A typical fighting game where you are a pig and every single wolf has rallied together to wipe you out. This game is a good time killer and I would consider it an 'Anti-Boredom' medicine. I would definitely recommend playing this as 1.) Its free!!!!!!! 2.) Good Time Killer 3.) FREE!!!!! 4.) Why not play it 5.) Simple and Fast Paced There is absolutely no reason not to play it, as it is  NOT ... 6.) GRAPHICS OR CPU INTENSIVE 7.) A LARGE GAME BY ANY MEANS 8.) CONFUSING OR HARD 9.) BORING OR COMPLEX I think my reasons are pretty valid and I would rate this game 8/10.

The piggy with the brick house gets pay back! Wreck havoc by absolutely destroying wolves that are after you and have simply ticked you off. You, the Iron Snout, get to beat the living $@%& out of these wolves with a great arsenal of rather unorthodox weapons.   Punch, kick, throw, chop and slice your way through hordes of wolves in this funny little Beat 'Em Up game! It's free to play so you might as well try it right?  If you enjoy death, gore, amputated limbs and bacon then here's the perfect game for you!    Thanks for reading! Check out these other links!   My Curator Group   Other Game Reviews

I only played like a few minutes of this and I LOVE IT. Simple one hand controls so you can kick wolf ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• with one hand while nomming on food of choice with the other. Gives me strong old school  adultswim.com  game vibes (I'm talking Tofu Hunter vibes of just senseless albeit cute violence) that will definitely remain in my steam library.  Need a game that can eat up some time while waiting for something to cook? This is that game. Need a game that can help you zone out while that other person drones on and on about something you care little of? This is that game. Need a game to make it look like you are working at work but are seriously just not here for it? This is that game.  Download this game. The power of kickass ninja porcine compels you.
Great way to pass short amounts of time. Very fun.

A surprisingly good game for all!  Where do i begin with the game....  First of all this game is free so what isn't to like download the game try it out if you like it great if you don't whats a few minutes of your time.  Firstly there is no objective to this game which for others may be a bad thing but for me is brilliant. This game can be played for hours or minutes it just depends on the type of person you are for me i use this game to pass the time give it a few attempts of beating my high score and thats me done.  Its a simple game that anyone can play, for a free game everything is as you would expect, and there is only one thing i can say about this game, download it to you libary and give it a try.  For me its a great game especially as it is free and you will only find this out if you try it.

You will succumb and end up as a roast, the question is how many will you take with you.

This is an actual, fully functional fighting game which plays as good as it looks! There are tons of moves, many of which can be strung together in inventive ways to form multiple-hit combos. You can also pick up and use weapons dropped by the wolves, though I still haven't figured out exactly how to do that (did it a few times by luck). Game would be tons better with a comprehensive movelist and specific instructions on how to perform certain actions. The graphics and sound are super adorable!
Tons of fun, no microtransactions, smooth controls, and a cute look.   11/10 would decimate local wolf population again

I have almost all the achievements and just wanted to put my two cents about this game. This is an excellent time waster game.    Story: There's really not much of a story. You play as a pig and you kill waves and waves of wolves that are after him for god knows what. But this game is really not about the story. But the main goal of the game is the get the highest score which you get one point every time you kill one wolf. You can also track and post your scores online and see how you are at the game with the rest of the world.   Gameplay: This is where the game shines and is the reason you'll keep coming back. You control the pig with W,S,A,D, he can jump,duck,kick, and punch left, right and up. The control is spot on and really satisfying to kill wolves. You also will be able to grab weapons from the wolves you kill, you can grab hats, chainsaws and more to add to your combo score much easier. All in all the gameplay is very fun and additive although can get repetitive if played in long sittings.  Graphics: Very simple but very nice 2D art of the wolves and pigs for such a simple games the graphics look very nice and slick. But i wish there was more backgrounds to choose from than just the same tree only background.  Bottom line:   You really can't go wrong with this game. It's free, can get highly additive and is great fun for anyone looking to kill a few minutes before going somewhere. I say overall i would give it a download and is fun for any type of gamer looking for a fun quick game to play.

Quite a good surprise. A very simplistic, yet addictive game where you play as a poor pig surrounded by knife-wielding, rocket-hugging pack of wolves. The gameplay is rather straight-forward, nothing much to do except surviving as long as you can. I'd love to see useless custom skins for the pig, new ennemies, backgrounds and fluff for this game, congrats to the developper for his first Steam release!

Iron Snout is a basic game where the objective is just to kill pigs. This game is also available on Android and iOS devices.  Pros: -Classic, beat-em-up fun -It's free -Incredibly small size -Easy achievements, although they take some time -No ingame transactions, as I'd expect from most games available on mobile platforms as well  Cons: -Sometimes dodging attacks is impossible  This is great fun and an amazing time waster for when you are bored, worth giving a look 7/10

You're a homicidal genderless pig disrguntled by a proud advanced wolf civilization consisting of construction workers, Chefs, Timber wolfs, Fire workers, Grandwolf gardners, and horny Rudolph the Red Nosed reindeer cosplayers. You must use your adept karate skills and porkchop the wolves' progressive movement and reclaim New Pork City's hamanity. I give this a 9/10 for not including a pig-latin language support but overall this game is a mastapiece and introduces a concise philisophical underpinning in less than 1 hour that most games try to do in 70 hours.

There was an old sow with three little pigs, and as she had not enough to keep them, she sent them out to seek their fortune. The first that went off met a man with a bundle of straw, and said to him, 'Please, man, give me that straw to build me a house.' Which the man did, and the little pig built a house with it.  Presently came along a wolf, and knocked at the door, and said, 'Little pig, little pig, let me come in.'  To which the pig answered, 'No, no, by the hair of my chiny chin chin.'  The wolf then answered to that, 'Then I'll huff, and I'll puff, and I'll blow your house in.' So he huffed, and he puffed and that little pig beat up the wolf because he was sick of dying whenever the story was told.

Super simple title.. pig chartacter defends self from wolf characters.  But... the combat is genuinely tasty.  It's silly, yeah; your character in this game doesn't even move left or right...  And somehow, it's still really fun.

Iron Snout features animal cruelty and gore, similar to what you would encounter in games like Manhunt and The Suffering. If you are planning on buying this game, think twice if you are sensitive to violence and blood. Jokes aside, in the game you control a pig that, after months of being constantly harrassed by the wolves, decides to break bad... and break bones. With a self explanatory and easy to understand playability, Iron Snout offers a challenging, yet, fun gameplay experience, that will entertain the player for hours on end. You will often find yourself trapped inside the game while trying to beat your own record (331 here). One complaint I would have to make is that the replay feature of the game is fairly low. After I finished getting all of the achievements, I felt like I had already 'played the game', and enjoyed whatever it had to offer to the utmost. The developers could have added more features to implement the game, like, for instance, a mode where the character could walk and interact with more objects, maybe find more guns and so on.  Nevertheless, if you want to challenge yourself (climb on the leaderboard), skip some time or just procrastinate, you would surely want to play this one, as it's an 'outside the box' game, and maybe have a couple laughs with it.
Really great little time waster, worth a try. No bugs, plays perfectly, feels great. Enjoy!

Iron Snout is a 'side-scroller' without the scroll. In it's rather simplistic game-play, you play as a pig in a desparate fight against the wolfs. It is an endless survival game where you stand in one spot and fight an endless horde of varying wolf enemy types. These enemies ranging from your simple, unarmed, charging wolf, to a crazed granny attacking you with her picnic basket. Your character (the pig) uses an alternating range of moves that are entertaining to use and to watch as the countless wolfs surrounding you are thrown about the small map. It's fun, it's challenging, a few of the achievements are a trial to get, and overall it's worth the asking price (free).

We've all heard the story of the three little pigs and the big bad wolf. Everyone hated that wolf for huffing and puffing and blowing their houses down. One of the little piggies had enough of the wolf and his kind, and decided to do something about it. This game is amzing if you are wanting to chop up some wolves. Otherwise, it may get old after you beat your highscore a few times.

At first this came doesn't seem like much and honestly it isn't and that's exactly what's so great about it. The developers have created a fun, quirky little game about beating the crap out of a bunch of wolves and haven't overly complicated it  Best of all it's 100% free
That's right, punks! This pork chops back! Lots of silly fun.

This game doesn't have a lot of content but what it does have is a lot of fun and very addicting. Easily attainable achievements keep me playing just one more game. And it's free so there isn't really a good reason why you shouldn't have it.

This review is not to say the game is bad, but rather to say it is overrated. The game is fun for mabye a minute. There are no exceptional graphics, no innovative game concepts, no good music, or anything really. It is just a normal, unoriginal game that should be lost in the crowd of other unoriginal, free steam games that nobody has ever heard about. This game should not be the highest rated game on steam. Who out there finds this game better than Half Life 2, CS:GO, Portal, Fallout, Dota, Arma, Crysis, and all the other AMAZING games on steam.

Overrated. Gets boring really quickly. Mashing 4 buttons to get nothing. Leaderboards and achievements. That's the end-game here.   Gotta love steam reviews where a 5mb game with a static background and simple boring mechanics gets upvoted to 98%.
